byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Damien Cave from Florida, Erik Eckholm from West Virginia, Dan Frosch and Kirk Johnson from Colorado, Ian Lovett from California, Kevin Sack from Georgia, Susan Saulny from Illinois, Katharine Q. Seelye from Wisconsin, A. G. Sulzberger from Iowa, Sabrina Tavernise from Delaware and Katie Zezima from New Hampshire and Maine.

docs.lead_paragraph: Republicans captured control of the House of Representatives on Tuesday and expanded their voice in the Senate, riding a wave of voter discontent as they dealt a setback to President Obama just two years after his triumphal victory. A Republican resurgence, propelled by deep economic worries and a forceful opposition to the Democratic agenda of health care and government spending, delivered defeats to House Democrats from the Northeast to the South and across the Midwest. The tide swept aside dozens of lawmakers, regardless of their seniority or their voting records, upending the balance of power for the second half of Mr. Obama's term.

headline.main: Republicans Take Control of House, Setting Back Democratic Agenda

docs.abstract: Republicans capture control of House of Representatives and expand their voice in Senate, riding wave of voter discontent as they deal setback to President Obama just two years after his triumphal victory; Republican resurgence is propelled by deep economic worries and forceful opposition to Democratic agenda of health care and government spending; tide sweeps aside dozens of lawmakers, regardless of their senority or their voting records, upending balance of power for second half of Obama's term; Democratics hang onto control of Senate; Republicans also prevail in statehouse races with Democrats poised to lose majority of governorships, particularly those in key presidential swing states; photos (M)
